topic.title: Submissions
topic.section: Submissions to the journal that are assigned to the Section Editor by the Editor appear in that Section Editor's In Review queue. Section Editors have access to only those submissions to which they have been assigned. Depending on the journal's policies, Section Editors may be responsible for just the Review of the submission or for the Review and the Editing of the Submission.

Submissions in this queue are subject to review resulting in a decision by the Section Editor made to accept or decline the submission. The extent of the review process - Is every Section of the journal subject to Peer Review? How many peer Reviewers per submission? Etc. - is spelled out in the journal's Review Policy. When a Section Editor or an Editor clicks on a submission title on the In Review Queue, they are taken to the submission's Review page. If the Section Editor accepts a submission, it moves to the In Editing queue, while if it is declined it moves to the Archives.

Submissions in this queue have been through the editorial process, whether they have been declined, scheduled to be published, or are published. This queue provides Editors and the assigned Section Editor complete access to the submission's editorial history (Summary, Submission, Review, Editing, and History).
